events.message: The applicant submitted a personal loan application to cover upcoming medical expenses and consolidate existing debt.
The application was categorised under Personal Loan as it clearly mentions coverage for medical expenses and debt consolidation.
Loan officer Sarah Jennings was assigned to manage the case and reach out for any clarifications on personal loan details.
The initial review focused on the applicant’s creditworthiness, income stability, and validating stated medical expenses.
Requested documents include medical bills, identification, proof of income, and summaries of existing debts for proper assessment.
Applicant submitted all necessary documents, including detailed medical invoices and current pay stubs, via secure online portal.
Credit check completed with an overall score favorable for loan approval but noting some recent late payments on credit card accounts.
Risk assessment concluded that the applicant poses a moderate risk due to medical expense volatility but has stable income streams.
A loan offer of $15,000 with a fixed interest rate of 7.5% over 36 months has been presented to the applicant.
The applicant responded positively to the offer and requested clarification on payment schedules before final acceptance.
Application was escalated to underwriting team for a final review due to the medical expense portion of the loan amount.
Underwriting approved the loan after confirming all medical documents and income verifications, allowing to proceed to funding.
Disbursed funds were transferred to the applicant’s bank account for use as intended, including medical bills and debt repayment.
Follow-up call was made to ensure the applicant is managing loan repayments comfortably and to offer any further assistance.
The loan application file was closed successfully after confirming the applicant’s satisfaction and successful loan disbursement.
